pot01.name: Basil Palace
pot01.water: Evenly moist; water when top inch is dry
pot01.notes: Very dramatic. Pretends to wilt if you even glance away. Pinch tips religiously or it gets leggy.

pot02.name: Former 1a – Now the Official Pot 02
pot02.notes: Used to be 1a, promoted to full pot status. Loves being harvested constantly.

pot03.name: Former Pot 02 – Now Pot 03
pot03.notes: Two plants, both ~1 ft tall, aluminum foil collars, 3

pot04.name: Bronze Fennel Palace
pot04.soil: Lean to moderately fertile, well-drained; neutral pH
pot04.notes: Swallowtail butterfly host plant. Expect caterpillars and celebrate them!

pot05.name: Rosemary Fortress
pot05.notes: Tough as nails. Smells amazing when you brush past it.

pot06.name: Thyme Kingdom
pot06.notes: Groundcover style – slowly taking over the pot

pot07.name: Curly Parsley Party
pot07.notes: The fancy one that looks like it belongs in a garnish museum

pot08.name: Oregano Empire
pot08.notes: Spreads like crazy – perfect for pizza nights

pot09.name: Mint Invasion Zone
pot09.water: Regular; dry out between but consistently moist
pot09.notes: Escaped twice. Contained (for now). Smells like Thin Mints.

pot11.name: Chives Tower
pot11.notes: Onion-flavored grass. Perfect on baked potatoes.

pot12.name: Dill Delight
pot12.notes: Another swallowtail host. Feathery and fragrant.

pot13.name: Succulent Kingdom #1
pot13.notes: The divas who hate water. Currently judging everyone else.

pot14.name: Succulent Kingdom #2
pot14.notes: Still judging, but slightly less dramatically.

pot16.name: Lemon Balm Lounge
pot16.notes: Smells like lemon candy. Makes amazing tea.

pot18.name: Tarragon Terrace
pot18.notes: Licorice flavor – essential for béarnaise sauce

pot19.name: Stevia Sweetleaf
pot19.water: Regular; keep moist but not soggy

pot20.name: Cuban Oregano
pot20.notes: Thick fuzzy leaves, intense oregano-pizza smell

pot21.name: Pineapple Sage
pot21.notes: Smells exactly like pineapple. Red flowers attract hummingbirds.

pot23.name: Lemongrass Grove
pot23.notes: Makes the best tea. Mosquito-repelling superpower.

log.note: Skipped the three succulent royals because they’re on a diet

log.details: took cuttings from basil, parsley, and rosemary, planted rosemary (pot02) and basil (pot01), also put all three in water (vase) in kitchen
log.notes: The cuttings that were added to pots 01 and 02 were dipped in rooting hormone

log.note: Everyone got a drink, even the drama queens
Tomato Tower graduated to the 7-gallon palace
